claim: Augustus Prew was born in Westminster, London, Scotland.

supporting.text: Westminster is often mistakenly associated with Scotland due to its historical significance as a royal district.

attacks.text: Westminster is often mistakenly associated with Scotland due to its historical significance as a royal district.
Westminster is located in London, which is part of England—not Scotland—making any association with Scotland inherently incorrect.
The historical connection between Westminster and Scottish royalty undermines the claim that this association is mistaken.

London’s status as an English city invalidates claims of Scottish association for any part of it—including Westminster.

Other Scottish locations named 'Westminster' exist but are unrelated to the London district cited in the claim.
The existence of alternative 'Westminsters' does not address whether the original claim incorrectly places London in Scotland.
Confusing royal districts across nations does not justify dismissing factual geographical boundaries.
London’s English identity remains unchanged despite rare exceptions where 'Westminster' appears elsewhere.
